list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Add Meesho machine coding interview experience. Around

task.summary: Default task
Improve runtime complexity by creating a mapping of sorted key of each word and checking whether the current word is a rotation of any of the words associated with current sorted key

Solve medium find the min swaps required to group all ones together using sliding window of fixed size by calculating no of 1's present in the window.
No of 0's present in a window needs to be swapped out.
Solve medium find whether the provided set of equations are valid or not by treating them as graph and using DSU to find connected components
Add Uber personal interview experience for posterity.
Solve easy convert roman number to integer by string parsing. Thing to note was to perform subtraction if the next char value > current char value

Solve medium and bit tricky problem, find the min steps required to transform x to y, given that you can double x or reduce x by 1 at any step by working backwards.
At each step, question yourself, which operation would have led me to this intermediate value in min steps.
Add personal google googlyness interview round experience
Add related subsequences problem. Both of the problem are similar, one with tighter constraint that requires an optimized approach.
Solve medium find the total score of parentheses expression using stack for representing nested expression.

Solve hard and extremely tricky find the minimum elements that needs to be removed to make a mountain array using LIS, one for left and another for right.
Was asked this question in DirectI Interview and was able to solve this question.

Solve medium and extremely tricky to optimize the find the celebrity index that does not know anyone but all remaining people know him using greedy logic similar to finding majority element in an array.

Solve medium and a bit tricky find the min operation required to generate n words given you can perform "copy all" or "paste" operation using DP. Need to consider some intermediate indices where we perform "copy all" operation, followed by "paste" and then optionally some more "copy all" followed by "paste".

Solve medium and a bit tricky to optimize from n^3 to n^2, find count of distinct substrings in a string using trie.
Learnings: Very similar to previously solved WordSearch2. toString() of stringBuilder is expensive as it's an O(n) operation.

Solve easy and extremely tricky to optimize, find the min moves to turn all array elements equal by incrementing n-1 elements by 1.
Trick was to simplify the problem by considering the operation as choosing one element and decrementing it by 1. Doing so is equivalent as the original operation as the relative distance is the same.
Add hint to reduce time complexity by using Suffix automaton

Solve medium and a bit tricky find the min steps required to make two strings anagram by swapping any character to any other character. Trick was to swap characters that in excess to characters that are in deficit.
Add explanation for handling right subtree

Solve medium and a bit tricky find the shortest encoding that represents the entire words. Two or more words can share the same suffix.
Leveraged prior learning of using Trie to solve prefix/suffix problem.
Rename classes to match problem name

Solve easy find the average of each level in a binary tree using DFS with multiple passes. First pass for finding the total element in each level and another pass for finding the total sum of elements in each level.
Solve easy find the min cost required to make alternating string of either "010101.." or "10101010..."

Solve medium and extremely tricky to optimize using DP, find the min no of operations to move all balls to current index.
Trick was to first divide the problem into left and right non overlapping subproblem and then try to leverage results of i-1th index to generate result at ith index.

Solve easy and a bit tricky problem, find the min operations to make a string empty by deleting palindromic subsequences in each operation.
Tricky thing to note here was since the input contains only 2 type of characters, answer can only be 0,1 or 2
Solve medium insert a new level in a binary tree by adding a dummy node in the new level and shifting all the children by 1 level using recursion
Solve medium represent a given integer into its corresponding roman value using greedy ie. picking the character with the largest numeric value first.
Add UpStox hackerrank interview experience
Add Directi interview experience for second design round, let's see what's the feedback !

Solve medium find whether a string contains all binary codes of size k using rolling hash or bitmask.
Learnings: Generating a rolling hash of fixed size using bitmask by &'ing with a mask of all one's of size k (11111) Generating rolling hash without bitmask was standard.

Solve easy and extremely tricky count binary substrings with equal no of 0's and 1's such that they are grouped consecutively by expanding equally from the center.
Initially tried to leverage prefix sum by changing 0 to -1 and finding substrings with same prefix sum but it gave WA. Trick was to compute different grouping length and expand from the center.
Update compass karat coding interview experience
Solve easy check if swapping two characters in a string can convert it into another string by keeping track of mismatched indices.
Solve medium find the center node of a star graph by counting the no of edges of each node. Center node must have exactly n-1 edges.
Solve medium convert a long url into tiny url by converting it into base62 using maths. Nice design question.

Solve medium stock selling problem, find the max profit that is possible by buying and selling stocks multiple times given there is a transaction fee every time you sell the stocks.
Leveraged prior learning of solving stock problems by first solving it in n^2 time, then optimizing it by keeping track of max offset found so far.

Generate medium and a bit tricky problem, generate a random point in a circle using rejection sampling.
Instead of worrying about generating a point in a circle, generate a point in a square and then discard it if it lies outside the circle. Big brain. Was able to come up with the solution on my own.
Update Directi interview experience with recruiter feedback and personal retrospective.
Add CoderByte screening experience of apna.co Overall score 17/20. Standard DP problems. Saved by the inefficiency of the platform.
Add Joveo first round interview experience. Went smooth as butter. Fingers crossed.
Update gotcha regarding comparing neighbourTime against curTime, the time this node was first visited instead of time[index]

Solve medium and tricky problem, construct binary tree from nested string using stacks.
Leveraged prior learning of using stack to solve nested stack problems. Trick was to properly link current node with the previous node upon encountering ')'. Care must be taken to handle cases like '))' and ')('
Add link to Upstox interview question.

Add Joveo second round interview experience. Probably got 3 WA due to integer overflow. Leetcode ruined me by providing input constraints in problem statements.
Learnings: In case of problem with no input constraints, make sure to consider integer overflow when doing integer arithmetic.

Solve medium and a bit tricky solution, find a permutation of A[] that has the maximum advantage over B[], advantage of an index in A[] occurs when A[i] > B[i], using Greedy algorithm.
Trick was to place the smallest number greater than B[i] in A[i]. If no such element exists, place the smallest unplaced element of A[]. This strategy reduces wastage and minimizes loss.

Add Twitter PhoneScreen interview experience. All hail LeetCode. Solved the question couple of hours before actual onsite.
Although I am confident to solve it during onsite itself, having solved it beforehand gave me an edge over all the bugs and edge cases.
Solve medium find smallest common element in all rows of a grid by keeping track of frequencies of each element. Smallest element with frequency == no of rows is the result.
Update Sense Machine coding interview result. Also add maven support to resolve open csv dependency.

Solve medium and tricky problem, find the max product of two words length such that these two words don't share any common character using bitmask.
During my initial thought process I could not think of using bitmasks and was leaning towards maintaining a reverse indexes for characters -> set of indexes of words.

Solve medium and extremely tricky reconstruction problem, reconstruct original digits from its scrambled english representation using tricky observation.
Initially I tried to solve using greedy where I greedily checked whether I could assign "zero", "one" or so on.. but it didn't work for input like "twonine", because "one" is present in the input and it didn't result in proper utilization of characters.
Trick was to find the unique characters of each digit and try to leverage that uniqueness to find how many times that digit exists e.g. 'z' is unique to "zero" and so on. Also check must be done in an ordered manner.
Add related problems dealing with max absolute difference

MESSAGE.value: Solve medium represent a given integer into its corresponding roman value using greedy ie. picking the character with the largest numeric value first.
Add UpStox hackerrank interview experience
Add Directi interview experience for second design round, let's see what's the feedback !

Solve medium find whether a string contains all binary codes of size k using rolling hash or bitmask.
Learnings: Generating a rolling hash of fixed size using bitmask by &'ing with a mask of all one's of size k (11111) Generating rolling hash without bitmask was standard.

Initially tried to leverage prefix sum by changing 0 to -1 and finding substrings with same prefix sum but it gave WA. Trick was to compute different grouping length and expand from the center.

Add related problems dealing with max absolute difference

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Add related problems dealing with max absolute difference
